original: FRIBERG, Oswald Leonard, Direktör, Jönköping, f Kalmar 14/12 90 av fältsk F L F o Charlotta Fahlberg, gm Barry Svenson. Realex, tekn elem.sk, spec.elev v KTH, spec.stud i tekn o hdlsämnen. Prakt v jvgsbyggn, verkstäder o elverk. Rit v Flottans ing.dep; montage- o projekting v eltekn ing.byrå; fabr.ing v tändsticksfabr i Gbg o Lidkp; driftsing o inköpschef v tändst.fabr i Gbg, Mönsterås, Smal Anneberg o Vvik; disp v Gbgs Tändst.fabr 29—32, ag av o vkst dir f AB Gustaf Sandwall (grund 1846), AB Nogo, Affärshuset i Jkp AB (samtl i Jkp). Styr.led o sekr i Jkps Köpm.frn o led dess arb.utsk, styr.led i Sv Ind.frn, Sv Kem Ind.frn, Sv Imp- o Exp-frn, Junemässan, Järnhandlarnas utbildnings-utsk o fredsberedskap, kassör i Jkps Flygklubb o i Segelflygets länskté, ordf i ö :a Storgatans Frn. Frimurare, PB, Odd Fellow, Cykelklubben Revansch o Jkps Jägarefrb (revisor), Tekn Frn i Jkp, Vätterbygdens El-män, Jkps o Halmstads Golfklubb, Jkps Cy-kelhandl.frn, Jkps Läns Byggn.mtrlhandl.frn. Jkps Segelsällsk, Jkps Roddklubb, Jkps Hö-gerfrns förtroenderåd mm. Hobby: Sport.
translated: FRIBERG, Oswald Leonard, Director, Jönköping, b. Kalmar 14/12 90, son of Field Sergeant F L F and Charlotta Fahlberg, m. Barry Svenson. Completed lower secondary school, technical elementary school, specialized studies at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in technology and trade subjects. Worked in road construction, workshops, and power plants. Designed for the Navy's engineering department; assembly and project management at an electrical engineering agency; factory engineer at a matchstick factory in Gothenburg and Lidköping; operational engineer and purchasing manager at matchstick factories in Gothenburg, Mönsterås, Smal Anneberg, and Vvik; general manager of Gothenburg Matchstick Factory from 1929 to 1932; district manager and growth director of AB Gustaf Sandwall (established 1846), AB Nogo, and Affärshuset i Jkp AB (all in Jönköping). Board member and secretary of Jönköping Merchants Association and member of its working committee; board member of Swedish Industry Association, Swedish Chemical Industry Association, Swedish Import and Export Association, Junemässan (trade fair), Iron Merchants' Education Committee, and Peace Preparedness Committee; treasurer of Jönköping Flying Club and Gliding County Committee; chairman of Storgatans Association; Freemason, member of the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Revansch Cycling Club, and Jönköping Hunters Association (auditor); Technical Association in Jönköping, Vätterbygd Electrical Guild, Jönköping and Halmstad Golf Club, Jönköping Cycling Retailers Association, and Jönköping County Building Materials Retailers Association; member of Jönköping Sailing Club, Jönköping Rowing Club, and Jönköping Right-wing Alliance Advisory Board, among others. Hobby: Sports.

structured.name: Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG
structured.description: Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG was born on December 14, 1890 in Kalmar, Sweden. He was the son of Field Sergeant F. L. FRIEBERG and Charlotta FAHLBERG. Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG worked as a director in Jönköping. He completed lower secondary school and technical elementary school, and then specialized in technology and trade subjects at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology). His career included work in road construction, workshops, and power plants. He designed for the Navy's engineering department and was involved in assembly and project management at an electrical engineering agency. Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG was a factory engineer at a matchstick factory in Gothenburg and Lidköping, and he also served as an operational engineer and purchasing manager at matchstick factories in Gothenburg, Mönsterås, Smal Anneberg, and Vvik. From 1929 to 1932, he held the position of general manager at Gothenburg Matchstick Factory. Additionally, he worked as a district manager and growth director of several companies in Jönköping, including AB Gustaf Sandwall (established 1846), AB Nogo, and Affärshuset i Jönköping AB. Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG was actively involved in various organizations, serving as a board member and secretary of Jönköping Merchants Association, board member of Swedish Industry Association, Swedish Chemical Industry Association, Swedish Import and Export Association, Junemässan (trade fair), Iron Merchants' Education Committee, and Peace Preparedness Committee. He also held treasurer positions at Jönköping Flying Club and Gliding County Committee. Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG was a member of Storgatans Association, a Freemason, member of the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, Revansch Cycling Club, and Jönköping Hunters Association (auditor). He was associated with various professional associations including Technical Association in Jönköping, Vätterbygd Electrical Guild, Jönköping and Halmstad Golf Club, Jönköping Cycling Retailers Association, and Jönköping County Building Materials Retailers Association. Furthermore, he was a member of Jönköping Sailing Club, Jönköping Rowing Club, and Jönköping Right-wing Alliance Advisory Board, among others. Oswald Leonard FRIEBERG had a great interest in sports as a hobby.

memberOf.name: Jönköping County Building Materials Retailers Association
